etymology.interpretation: 木 signals a wooden object, pointing to meanings like board or plank. 反 contributes the sound, aligning with the modern reading bǎn; the sense of “stiff” extends metaphorically from something flat and rigid like a plank.

examples.chinese: 请把这块板抬到门口(請把這塊板抬到門口)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ zhè kuài bǎn tái dào ménkǒu.
examples.english: Please carry this plank to the doorway.

examples.chinese: 他板着脸不说话(他板著臉不說話)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎn zhe liǎn bù shuōhuà.
examples.english: He kept a stiff face and didn't speak.

examples.chinese: 这块木板很结实(這塊木板很結實)。
examples.english: This wooden board is very sturdy.
